meanings.definition: A group of sports teams that play against each other.
meanings.sent1: In the local youth league, my team won the championship.
meanings.sent2: The soccer league consists of ten teams competing for the title.
meanings.sent3: The baseball league had a game where all the players wore silly costumes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a star player in the league of life, always striving for victory.
meanings.sent5: The competitive spirit in the league was palpable, driving each team to do their best.

meanings.definition: A group of nations or organizations united for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The League of Nations was formed after World War I to promote peace.
meanings.sent2: The European Union is an economic and political league of countries.
meanings.sent3: The superhero league joined forces to defeat the villain and save the city.
meanings.sent4: Together, the countries formed a powerful league to address climate change.
meanings.sent5: The league of allies stood strong against the common enemy, showing solidarity.

meanings.definition: A unit of distance equal to three miles.
meanings.sent1: The hikers trekked a league through the forest to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The ship traveled a league across the open sea to reach the port.
meanings.sent3: The friends joked that they would walk a league to get the best ice cream in town.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was immeasurable, stretching a league in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner pushed through the last league of the race, fueled by determination.
